treatment.reference: Methanocella paludicola gen. nov., sp. nov., a methane-producing archaeon, the first isolate of the lineage ‘Rice Cluster I’, and proposal of the new archaeal order Methanocellales ord. nov. IJSEM 58:929-936
treatment.description: Cells occur singly and almost all of the cells are rod-shaped; however, coccoid cells were observed in late-exponential culture. Cells stain Gram-negative, are non-motile and are resistant to lysis by 2% (w/v) SDS. Methane produced from H2 and formate. Acetate is required for growth and yeast extract supported growth. No growth or methane production from pyruvate, lactate, acetate, 1-propanol, 2-propanol, ethanol, 1-butanol, 2-butanol, cyclopentanol, methanol, methylamine, trimethylamine, dimethylamine, and propionate. Growth occurs between 25 and 40 ˚C with the optimum at 35–37 ˚C. The pH range is 6.5–7.8; optimum growth occurs at pH 7.0. Growth was observed in medium containing less than 1 g NaCl per liter (17 mM). The DNA G+C content is 56.6 mol%. The type strain, isolated from a rice paddy soil at Nagaoka, Niigata, Japan, is SANAET (=JCM 13418T=NBRC 101707T=DSM 17711T).
